settings.heading: certificate of analysis
settings.text: Organna CBD tests all product batches at 3rd party ISO-accredited labs for full transparency and quality control. These labs provide us with a Certificate of Analysis, or COA, which we make available to you. Each product will have it's own COA page.  Use the information below to find the COA for any product you’ve purchased or review the latest product batch lab results before you purchase.

settings.title: We take Lab Testing Seriously, So you don't have to!
settings.content:
Organna CBD is committed to providing a fully transparent experience when using and researching our ingredients, product sources, laboratory test results and everything in-between. Each Lab result has been performed by a Certified 3rd Party lab and available for your viewing through our COA Database. Keep in mind, a single SKU may have multiple batch numbers. Make sure you enter or look up the Batch ID # that is labeled on your product's label.

​

Each product sold by Organna CBD will have a corresponding Certificate of Analysis that can be accessed through our COA database search. Each BatchID# will lead to a dedicated page containing additional information on the particular batch of product, ingredient profiles, terpene profiles, product uses and quality control methods.

settings.title: take out the guesswork.
settings.subtitle: 100% Reliable. 100% Transparent.
settings.header__text: What is a COA and how do I read it?
settings.text1: A Certificate of Analysis, or COA, helps to ensure that a cultivator or manufacturer’s products are grown, extracted, and manufactured to specification. A COA will reveal the exact quantity of each specific cannabinoid, terpene, and other compounds found in each product. Don't be intimidated by the large words and compound names, it's quite simple. The first page contains a summary of all tests performed

settings.card_desc: On every Organna CBD product, there will be a QR code either on the product primary label or the box the product came in. Scan the QR code with your smartphone camera. Once you've scanned the QR, you will enter your Batch ID # as listed under the QR.

Each manufactured batch is tested and will contain it's own Batch ID #. Remember, a single SKU can have various Batch ID #s. Make sure when entering you Batch ID #, you read the printed Batch ID under the QR code. Enter your BatchID & view your COA results.

Each product page contains basic Lab Test results and a link to the full COA Page for the latest product batch. Keep in mind, if you purchase from a retailer or based on online product turnover, BatchID may be different. You can use methods 1 &2 to find your COA.

settings.title: how to find your lab results.
settings.desc: You don't have to jump through hoops to make sure your CBD product is safe. We help you find your Lab Results (Certificate of Analysis - COA) faster, no matter what method you choose. Find an ideal method for you from the options below:

settings.title: Search your COA.
settings.btn_text: search by Batch ID# or by a product name

settings.desc: can't find what you're looking for?

settings.title: What is hemp extract?
settings.text: Hemp extract is derived from all components of the hemp plant's leaves, flowers, and stems. The extract comprises cannabinoids, terpenes, fatty acids, flavonoids, vitamins, and nutrients. This liquid concentrate can be distilled to retain only specific compounds from the plant.

settings.title: Is Hemp Extract Safe?
settings.text: According to our research, this ingredient is SAFE! Organna CBD only uses All-Natural ingredients in the formulation of our products.

settings.title: What’s the difference between Hemp Extract and Hemp Seed Oil?
settings.text:
Hemp extract is made using the entire hemp plant and its aerial parts. It contains many phytocannabinoids (including CBD), terpenes, and flavonoids.

Hemp Seed Oil is a hemped-derived and often used in many foods, health and cosmetic products. It does not contain CBD and has not been found to hold any medicinal value. Also, Hemp seed oil is an extract of only the hemp plant's seeds

settings.title: What’s the difference between Hemp and CBD?
settings.text:
CBD (cannabidiol) and hemp extract are related but not the same thing. Here are the key differences:

  • CBD (Cannabidiol):
  • Hemp Extract:

CBD is one component of hemp extract, but hemp extract can contain a wider array of compounds from the hemp plant. Depending on the extraction process, it can either retain the full spectrum of compounds or isolate specific elements like CBD.

When you're shopping for CBD products, it's essential to check labels to understand whether it's pure CBD isolate or a full-spectrum/broad-spectrum product containing additional compounds. The quality and effectiveness of these products can vary based on the extraction method and the presence of other cannabinoids and compounds.
